NRL: Panthers v Cowboys at BlueBet Stadium. Preliminary match at 2pm, NRL kick-off at 4.05pm, full time approx. 6.05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as thousands of fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Wests Tigers at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 6:15pm, full time around 8.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd.  
  • Due to the Moore Park Road pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Road onto Moore Park Road westbound. Motorists can use Cook Road for access onto Moore Park Road instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 10pm on sections of Lang Road, Fitzroy Street, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

A section of Mary St will close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel St while the closure is in place.

NRL: Bulldogs v Warriors at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 12.40pm. NRL kick-off at 3pm, full time around 4.45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as footy fans travel to the precinct.

Motorists should add extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd. 

Fans should consider catching public transport or parking at a nearby station commuter carpark to connect with trains to Olympic Park to avoid traffic delays.

Fans who must drive should carpool with their group and pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. Avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Dr roundabout and use Silverwater Rd, Holker St and Hill Rd to access car parks.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, see the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice:
Around 7,000 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k on Sunday 28 July.

Events start from George St in The Rocks from 7:30am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf , Darling Harbour and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the event, road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4am to 1pm: Circular Quay West at the OPT
  • 4:30am to 11am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd, Hickson Rd from George St to Park Hyatt, and the OPT Upper Roadway
  • 6am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Barton St, Sussex St between Napoleon St and Erskine St, northbound lanes of Sussex St from King St to Erskine St, Slip St and Barton St.
  • 6am to 11am: Hickson Rd from Park Hyatt to Barton St, and Napoleon St. Sections of Dalgety St and Towns Pl.
  • 7.30am to 10am: Sections of Murray St & Pirrama Rd, and Wharf 7/10 Service Rd in Pyrmont.
  • 8.30am to 9:30am: Barangaroo Ave, Cuthbert St, Erskine St, King St, Lime St, Shelley St and Watermans Quay at King St Wharf.

Changed local access arrangements will be in place around King Street Wharf/Barangaroo between 8:30am and 9:15am and in Pyrmont between 7:30am and 10am. There will be no exit from the King Street Wharf area between 8:30am and 9:15am due to the closure of Sussex St. Access in via Harbour St/Wheat Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 6,000 participants will take part in the annual Sutherland 2 Surf fun run and walk from Sutherland to Cronulla via the Kingsway from 7.30am. Roads around the start area will close from 5am with all closures in place by 7.40am. Roads progressively reopen from 8.20am, with all roads reopened by 10.30am.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • Sutherland from 5am: sections of Flora St and Acacia Rd. 
  • Gymea to Cronulla from 7am to 10am: the eastbound lanes of the Kingsway will be closed from the Princes Hwy to Elouera Rd, and will progressively reopen from 8.20am. The speed limit on the Kingsway westbound lanes will be reduced to 40km/h from 7am to 10.30am and delays are expected. Motorists travelling north of the Kingsway should use The Boulevarde/Captain Cook Dr. Motorists travelling south of the Kingsway should use President Ave. 
  • Kirrawee from 7am: Bath Rd South, Clements Pde, Flora St and Oak Rd. 
  • Gymea from 7am to 8.20am: Hotham Rd. From 7.20am, the Kingsway westbound lanes will be closed between Talara Rd and the Princes Hwy, and the northbound lanes of Talaea Rd will be closed between Warburton St and the Kingsway. 
  • Miranda / Caringbah from 7.30am: southbound lanes of Kiora Rd, eastbound lanes of Port Hacking Rd and Taren Point Rd. Central Rd will also be closed from 7am. 
  • Caringbah from 7am: Banksia Rd, Denman Ave, Yathong Rd. Gannons Rd will close at 7.40am. 
  • Woolooware from 7am: Dolans Rd, Fowler St and Hughes St. 
  • Cronulla from 5am: Prince St. 
  • Cronulla from 7am: Mitchell Rd and Elouera Rd. While Elouera Rd is closed between 7.30am and 9.50am, access to North Cronulla is via Captain Cook Dr, and access to South Cronulla is via President Ave and Burraneer Bay Rd. 

Motorists will still be able to cross the Kingsway at various points before and after runners pass major intersections including at Hotham Rd, Milburn Rd/Gymea Bay Rd, Manchester Rd, Sylvania Rd, Wandella Rd, Kiora Rd, Kareena Rd, Taren Point Rd and Gannons Rd.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in place, however vehicles parked along the route cannot be moved while the event is underway. Greenhills car park in Cronulla will be closed from 2pm Sat 20 July until midday Sun 21 July to accommodate the event finish line.

arrangementElements.html:
FROM 2PM SATURDAY 20 JULY TO 12PM SUNDAY 21 JULY

Greenhills Beach car park will be closed from the corner of Mitchell Road and Murdock Street, Cronulla.

(3) Access to Kirrawee Station and shopping precinct via President Avenue.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads crossing the Kingsway will close and reopen as the event passes through, between 7.20am and 9.50am.

Motorists will be able to cross the Kingsway at locations before and after runners pass major intersections at:

  • Hotham Road before 7.20am and after 8am
  • Milburn Road/Gymea Bay Road before 7.20am and after 8.20am
  • Manchester Road before 7.20am and after 8.20am
  • Sylvania Road before 7.20am and after 8.20am
  • Wandella Road before 7.20am and after 8.40am
  • Kiora Road before 7.30am and after 8.50am
  • Kareena Road before 7.30am and after 9.10am
  • Taren Point Road before 7.40am and after 9.10am
  • Gannons Road before 7.40am and after 9.25am
  • Elourea Road before 7.30am and after 9.50am

AFL: Sydney Swans v Fremantle Dockers at the SCG. First bounce at 1.45pm, full time around 4.25pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match.

Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the area before and after the game as delays are expected. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde, Oxford St and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 10.45am and will reopen after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave.
  • Access to EP2 car park will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd. Car parks open from 10.45am.
  • Due to the Moore Park Rd pop up cycleway, there is no left-turn permitted from Lang Rd onto Moore Park Rd westbound. Motorists can use Cook Rd for access onto Moore Park Rd instead.  

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas between 11am and 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Oxford St, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

FROM 11AM TO 6PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Cleveland Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on stadium shuttle buses. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Eels at McDonald Jones Stadium. Jersey Flegg from 1.15pm and NSW Cup from 3pm. NRL kick-off at 5.30pm, full-time around 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Griffiths Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend Urzila Carlson comedy show. Shows start at 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Darling Dr

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Dolphins at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. NRL kick-off at 2pm, full time around 4pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street
